title: Improved weekend bus services for four routes in the Bellarine and Surf Coast
articleContent:
From Sunday 1 December 2019, four bus routes in the Bellarine will be more frequent on weekends. An extra 48 return services will be added to routes 55, 56, 60 and 61 – an additional three return services every Saturday and Sunday, on each of the four routes.

Follow the links below to access your new timetable:

Route 55 Geelong Station to Ocean Grove via Barwon Heads

Route 56 Geelong Station to Queenscliff via Ocean Grove

Route 60 Geelong Station to St Leonards via Portarlington

Route 61 Geelong Station to Drysdale via Clifton Springs

Route 60 will be adjusted to turn left from Cole St onto Leviens Road and terminate there when travelling from Geelong Station.

When travelling to Geelong Station, it will depart Leviens Road and travel via Mainsail Drive, Sandbar Street, Seachange Way, then continue on Leviens Road to the current route.

Route 61 will also be extended along Centennial Boulevard to Curlewis Shopping Centre, instead of turning around at the roundabout at Sealark Way.

The new timetables are available online and in Journey Planner. To order a printed copy, call 1800 800 007
